data: NIA Nausea and Vomiting
Status
Nurse Independent Activity
For practice guidelines, refer to Decision Support Tool (DST): Nausea, Vomiting

Exceptions / Contraindications:  - Known/suspected head injury, cerebral edema, pulmonary edema, CHF may exhibit GI symptoms. Notify physician immediately  - Pregnant or lactating mother (MD consult/order required)  - History for glaucoma  - History of prostatic hypertrophy  - Headache, vision changes and nausea may be signs of increased intracranial pressure  - Platelet count less than 50,000 for intramuscular routes
Medications
If unable to tolerate PO select IV, IM or Rectal route
dimenhyDRINATE PRN range dose
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: oral liq
dimenhyDRINATE PRN range dose
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
dimenhyDRINATE PRN range dose
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IM, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
dimenhyDRINATE PRN range dose
dose range: 50 to 100 mg, rectal, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: supp
Communication Orders
Notify Treating Provider
Notify treating provider for ongoing therapy
